business.headline: PM Modi to inaugurate 'Rising Rajasthan Global Investment Summit' tomorrowAiming to bolster investment opportunities in Rajasthan, Prime Minister Narendra Modi to unveil the Rising Rajasthan Global Investment Summit in Jaipur on Monday, December 9.

Not doing any sale: Unacademy CEO Gaurav Munjal denies reports of takeover dealReports earlier suggested that Allen Career Institute was in talks to acquire Unacademy for $800 million, significantly lower than its peak valuation of $3.4 billion.

India can become the AI capital of the world: Meta's Sandhya DevanathanSandhya Devanathan, Vice President and Head of India at Meta, discusses the company's AI initiatives, including Meta AI and Llama models.

We are going to be future ready: Priyank Kharge on AI transforming job marketSharing his thoughts on AI creating a job deficit, Priyank Kharge, Minister of IT and Biotechnology of Karnataka said that technological evolution creates new opportunities rather than eliminating them.

Forging the future: CP Gurnani, Aditya Ghosh discuss AI's role in empowering IndiaCP Gurnani highlighted the necessity of blending AI with human capabilities. Aditya Ghosh emphasised the accessibility of AI, calling this era a "magical time" akin to the Industrial Revolution.

Firms using AI to empower workforce likely to excel in future: Professor Das NarayandasSpeaking at the India Today-Business Today AI Conference 2024, during a session titled 'Leadership.Change.AI', he emphasised that organisations focusing on how AI can augment their workforce are likely to emerge as industry leaders.

Paytm share price hits 52-week high today. What's driving the rally?Paytm share price: The stock jumped 3.60% to hit a 52-week high of Rs 990.90 on Friday. At the closing bell, the stock settled 1.89% higher at Rs 974.55.
Sensex, Nifty end flat as RBI maintains status quo on interest ratesThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 56.74 points to end at 81,709.12, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 30.60 points to close at 24,677.80.
Insurance claims denied? Nithin Kamath explains why and what you can doNithin Kamath warns that having insurance doesn't guarantee full claims and lists common rejection reasons.

MCX share price hits Rs 7,000 milestone as stock rallies over 8%The stock has delivered an impressive growth trajectory, with gains of over 100% in the past year, over 300% in the last three years, and more than 500% over the last five years.

Explained: Why Vedanta share price jumped over 6% todayThe surge in stock price follows an announcement from Vedanta Resources Finance II PLC, a subsidiary of VRL, that it had redeemed the full amount of $1.2 billion in bonds due in 2025 but extended to 2028.

RBI MPC: Homebuyers may have to wait till 2025 for EMI reliefThe RBI has kept key lending rates unchanged with Governor Shaktikanta Das explaining the Monetary Policy Committee's (MPC) focus on economic stability.

RBI cuts CRR to 4%: How this liquidity boost will benefit economyThe decision to cut CRR is expected to benefit the banking sector, particularly public sector banks, by lowering the cost of funds and increasing lending capacity.

EPFO extends deadline to activate UAN for ELI scheme. Check final dateThe EPFO has extended the deadline to link UAN and Aadhaar under the ELI scheme to mid-December, aiming to boost job creation with incentives for employees and employers.
RBI MPC announcement: 7 important decisions you should know aboutThe Reserve Bank of India's monetary policy update includes key decisions like CRR reduction, increase in farm loan limits and more.

RBI increases UPI Lite transaction limit: How will you benefit?The RBI has increased transaction limits for UPI Lite, making digital payments more convenient, flexible, and accessible for customers, especially for low-value and offline transactions.

'Our job is…': RBI Governor defends policy amid criticism over lending ratesShaktikanta Das explained that the decision to hold rates stems from a dual focus on managing inflation and supporting growth. He acknowledged the recent rise in inflation, primarily due to food prices, and the moderation in economic growth

What is Cash Reserve Ratio? Understanding RBI's liquidity management toolThe RBI cut the Cash Reserve Ratio (CRR) to 4% on December 6, injecting Rs 1.16 lakh crore into the banking system to boost liquidity, credit flow, and economic growth.
RBI keeps key rates unchanged, cuts CRR to 4%: What it means for stock marketAt 11:23 am, the Sensex was down 13.04 points at 81,752.82, while the Nifty50 declined 12.05 points to trade at 24,695.80.

Lower GDP forecast to CRR boost: 6 key takeaways from RBI MPCThe MPC decided by a 4-2 majority to maintain the policy repo rate at 6.5%. Governor Shaktikanta Das explained that this decision was based on an assessment of the economy and financial conditions.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Syrian rebels seize control over Damascus palaces as Assad flees to RussiaBashar al-Assad had boarded a plane in Damascus for a destination that was not known. Later, Russia, one of his closest allies, confirmed that he had left Syria.

Bangladesh Police file case against Hindu monk Chinmony Das, his followersEnamul Haque, a Hefazat-e-Islam activist, filed a case naming Hindu monk Chinmoy Krishna Das along with 164 identified and over 500 unidentified persons accusing them of attacking him at the Chittagong court.

Delhi braces for cold wave as temperature likely to plunge to 3°C next weekCurrently, Delhi's minimum temperature hovers around 7°C. However, the chilling conditions are predicted to intensify due to a combination of factors, including snowfall in the northern hills and the influence of a Western Disturbance, which could bring light showers to the plains.

BJP vs Congress as Iltija Mufti's 'Hindutva a disease' remark sparks rowIltija Mufti's remarks on Hindutva has sparked a political debate, with the BJP defending its ideology, the Congress advocating respect for all religions, and criticism aimed at the Muftis for 'divisive' statements.

Why solo trips are essential, even when you have a partner or kidsTravelling solo might seem odd when you have a partner, but it offers unique benefits that strengthen both your relationship and personal growth.

'On George Soros payroll': BJP's retort to Shashi Tharoor's 'attack-dog' jibeUnion Minister Kiren Rijiju slammed Shashi Tharoor on Sunday for his remarks on the BJP's claims of US "deep state" interference in India and suggested the Congress leader not to act as if he was on "payroll of George Soros".

Trump calls Russia-Ukraine war 'madness', says China can help broker peace Trump made these remarks on Sunday via his social media platform, Truth Social, just hours after meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Paris. This meeting marked the first face-to-face talks between Trump and Zelenskyy since Trump's election victory last month.

Gukesh credits team for lead in Game 11: Don't think Liren was playing for drawIndian teenage Grandmaster D. Gukesh has attributed his crucial victory in Game 11 to his team's meticulous preparation, as he moves closer to securing his first World Chess Championship title.

Sombre Sunday: India complete unwanted hat-trick on December 8 in cricketIndian cricket faced a tough day as the men's team lost the pink-ball Test to Australia, the women's team was defeated in the ODI series, and the U-19 team fell to Bangladesh in the Asia Cup final.

Pakistan Super League franchises eye unsold foreign IPL players for 2025Pakistan franchise owners have submitted a list of unsold overseas IPL players to the PCB for the PSL draft. The potential overlap of PSL and IPL seasons next year adds a new dimension to player availability decisions.

Video: Gujarat man thrashes bank manager, rips his shirt over deposit disputeA viral video shows a man thrashing and ripping the shirt of a Union Bank of India manager in Ahmedabad over a dispute over increased TDS on his fixed deposit.

'Good news': World leaders respond to Syrian President's ouster. Check reactionsSyrian rebels ousted President Bashar al-Assad, seizing Damascus and ending his decades-long rule. After 13 years of civil war, shifting alliances, a distracted Russia, and weakened Hezbollah left Assad vulnerable.

Erdogan's dual strategy in Syria: Hunting with NATO, running with RussiaFor over a decade, Syria has been a battleground where various international interests have clashed, with Turkey playing a pivotal role. However, Turkey's involvement is complicated by its position as a NATO member, often putting it at odds with Assad's other key ally, Russia.
University of Bath School of Management: A Leader in Global Business EducationCombining top-ranked MSc programmes with practical knowledge for future corporate leaders.

Man accused of human trafficking arrested after 2,500-km long chase in HyderabadThe accused, Kamran Haider alias Zaidi, allegedly lured victims through his consultancy firm, Ali International Services, and used to traffic them to Thailand and Laos.

Farmers suspend 'Dilli Chalo' march for today after 9 injured in tear gas shellingThe farmers were stopped by the Haryana Police just a few meters away from the Shambhu border, resulting in clashes. The police responded by firing tear gas shells to disperse the protesters.

Syria after Assad: New ruler, key political figures and uncertain futureThirteen years after the civil war that killed over 5 lakh people, on December 8, Bashar al-Assad fled that country and opposition fighters took charge. So how did this historic event unfold?

Why men too should take the cervical cancer vaccineOncologist Dr Niti Raizada says vaccinating both women and men against the human papillomavirus can significantly contain cervical cancer while protecting males from related cancers

Why Bhut Jolokia, once world's hottest chilli pepper, is losing its stingBhut Jolokia or Naga Mircha from India's northeast was recorded as the world's hottest chilli pepper in 2007. It is becoming a victim of its fame and witnessing an erosion in its heat quotient. Here's what led to the Ghost Pepper losing its sting and what can be done to preserve its heat and unique flavour.

Fight between monkeys over banana disrupts train operations at Bihar railway stationA scuffle between two monkeys over a banana caused a piece of rubber to slip from one monkey's grip and fall onto the overhead wires below. The collision caused a short circuit, with sparks flying from the wires.

Delhi influencer uses green chillies as 'natural lip plumper'. Video angers InternetA Delhi-based beauty influencer has angered the internet after she shared a video of herself using green chillies as a "natural lip plumper".

Will help if needed, but civil war is Syria's fight: Russian lawmaker Syrians will have to face a full-scale civil war on their own, said Konstantin Kosachyov, deputy chairman of Russia's upper house of parliament, on Sunday, while indicating that Moscow remains willing to support the Syrian people under specific circumstances.
From the India Today archives (2005) | Sonia Gandhi: Such a long journeyThe Maino girl, who dreamt of becoming a flight attendant but kept her tryst with destiny in India, turns 78 on December 9

Inside Sharmila Tagore's fun birthday lunch with Sara, Saif and KareenaActor Sara Ali Khan shared a bunch of photos on her Instagram handle to mark her grandmother and actor Sharmila Tagore's birthday. The images also featured Kareena Kapoor and Saif Ali Khan.

Sobhita Dhulipala shares dreamy wedding pics with Naga ChaitanyaActor Sobhita Dhulipala on Sunday shared dreamy wedding photos with actor Naga Chaitanya. The pair got married in Hyderabad on December 4.

Shalini Passi says she would like to take Mira Rajput with her on BB 18Fabulous Lives vs Bollywood Wives star Shalini Passi recently disclosed two celebrities she would love to take with her on Salman Khan's Bigg Boss 18, one of whom is Shahid Kapoor's wife and influencer Mira Rajput.

Photos: Salman Khan attends Iulia Vantur's father's birthday celebrationBollywood superstar Salman Khan recently attended Iulia Vantur's father's intimate birthday celebration in Mumbai. Iulia later shared photos from the bash on her social media handle.

sports.headline: Palmer breaks Premier League record in Chelsea's 4-3 win over SpursCole Palmer scored twice from the penalty spot as Chelsea staged a dramatic comeback, recovering from 2-0 down to defeat Tottenham Hotspur 4-3 in a thrilling London derby. Palmer has now scored the most penalties without missing in Premier League history.

Mikel Arteta delivers fresh Arsenal injury update after draw at FulhamWith the Monaco game fast approaching, Mikel Arteta will be hoping his defensive options are bolstered by the potential returns of Gabriel, Zinchenko, and Calafiori, allowing Arsenal to maintain their strong form in both domestic and European competitions.

Arsenal frustrated by Fulham once againArsenal were held to a 1-1 draw by London rivals Fulham in a Premier League clash on a grey, wet Sunday at Craven Cottage. Raul Jimenez gave the hosts an early lead, while William Saliba equalized for the visitors at the start of the second half.

2nd Test: Dhananjaya de Silva-Mendis stand keeps Sri Lanka alive on Day 4South Africa need five wickets, while Sri Lanka require 143 runs as the second Test heads for a potentially thrilling conclusion on Monday, with both teams desperate for victory in their bid for a place in the World Test Championship final.

Watch: Emotional Hamilton wows crowd with donuts in final Mercedes raceLewis Hamilton ended his 12-year Mercedes journey with an emotional farewell at the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix, marking the end of an era filled with historic achievements and the beginning of a new chapter with Ferrari.

Sunil Gavaskar shares advice on how day-night Tests can thriveAUS vs IND, 2nd Test: Sunil Gavaskar shared a suggestion about Day-Night Tests, saying that pink-ball matches should be hosted by cities with a busy corporate life.

Ben Stokes credits England's dominant style of play for New Zealand series winEngland captain Ben Stokes has lauded his team's bold and aggressive approach following a resounding 323-run victory in Wellington, marking their first Test series triumph in New Zealand in 16 years. Reflecting on the achievement, Stokes highlighted the significance of their attacking mindset.

Should Jasprit Bumrah play all 5 Tests vs Australia? Sunil Gavaskar respondsSunil Gavaskar commented on Jasprit Bumrah's workload management and claimed that the pacer should play all the matches in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Bumrah has been India's best bowler in the series against Australia so far.

Siraj vs Head and more: Pink-ball Test drama spices up Border-Gavaskar TrophyThe Adelaide Test added much-needed excitement to the Border-Gavaskar Trophy after a notably respectful build-up to the series. The Test match featured a massive controversy between Mohammed Siraj and Travis Head, among other dramatic moments.

Australia were simply better than India in the Adelaide Test: GavaskarIndian cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar believes that Australia were simply better than India in terms of both batting and bowling in the Adelaide Test, and urged the Rohit Sharma-led side to revamp their approach for the upcoming Gabba Test.

Siraj is gonna give it back to Australia doubly in kind in Gabba: GavaskarMohammed Siraj faced intense challenges in Adelaide but earned Sunil Gavaskar's backing to retaliate with fiery performances in Gabba after a heated exchange with Travis Head and relentless bouncers from Australia's pace attack marked the second Test.

PV Sindhu, fiance Venkata Datta Sai invite Sachin Tendulkar for weddingSachin Tendulkar wished PV Sindhu as the badminton star is set to marry Venkata Datta Sai on December 22. Sindhu recently bagged the Syed Modi international title after beating China's Wu Luo Yu in the final.

Bangladesh successfully defend U19 Asia Cup title after beating India U19 Men's Asia Cup 2024: Bangladesh, led by Azizul Hakim, won the tournament after beating Mohamed Amaan's India in the final by 59 runs on Sunday, December 8 at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium.

Jay Shah is no one's fool, he will do wonders as ICC Chair: Ravi Shastri Former India captain Ravi Shastri heaped praise on Jay Shah's administrative acumen, backing the newly-appointed ICC chair to make the global cricket body a more powerful organisation.

That's Siraj for you: AB de Villiers reacts to pacer's verbal spat with HeadFormer South African legend AB de Villiers shared his views on Mohammed Siraj's fiery exchange with Travis Head during the Adelaide Test, praising the Indian pacer's passion while advocating limits on personal or offensive sledging.

Rohit Sharma's run drought affecting his captaincy? Harbhajan explainsHarbhajan Singh emphasised the pressing need for Rohit Sharma to rediscover his form as both a batter and captain, following India's humiliating defeat in Adelaide, where questions about his leadership and batting slump grew louder.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
